text.__SUMMARY__: Acer obtusifolium, common name the Syrian Maple is a Middle-eastern species of maple.
text.Description: Acer obtusifolium is an evergreen maple that forms a shrub, but can also be grown into a tree to a height of about 16 feet. It has leathery foliage varying from unlobed to tri-lobed. The leaves are normally gray-green.
text.Distribution: This species is found from eastern Turkey, Syria, Lebanon, Cyprus, and in Israel in Hermon and Galilee. It grows along coastal mountains.
